meanings.definition: A sequence of single notes that is musically satisfying.
meanings.sent1: The melody of the song was easy to remember.
meanings.sent2: She hummed a beautiful melody while walking in the park.
meanings.sent3: The melody of the alarm clock made waking up a bit more pleasant.
meanings.sent4: His words flowed together like a sweet melody, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: The melody of the wind chimes filled the air with tranquility.

meanings.definition: A pleasing succession or arrangement of sounds.
meanings.sent1: The melody of laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent2: The melody of the birds chirping in the morning was delightful.
meanings.sent3: The melody of the raindrops on the roof was like a soothing lullaby.
meanings.sent4: Her dance moves were in perfect harmony with the melody of the music.
meanings.sent5: The melody of the waves crashing against the shore was mesmerizing.
